newsitem.title: SPAIN: Madrid stocks end flat ahead of All Saints holiday.
newsitem.headline: Madrid stocks end flat ahead of All Saints holiday.

text.p: MADRID, Oct 31 (Reuter) 1615 GMT - Madrid stocks ended flat on Thursday after a listless day's trade ahead of Friday's All Saints' public holiday.

The tone was cautious as dealers closed positions ahead of the long weekend and key U.S. payroll data, also due on Friday. * General index down 0.16 points, 0.04 percent, to 375.73 * Ibex down 2.03 points, 0.05 percent, to 4,306.74 * Argentaria limited losses via a large buy order just before the close. Ended off 50 pesetas at 5,000 in heavy trade after posting on Wednesday a 13.1 percent fall in net profit for the nine months to September, well below analyst expectations. * Telefonica continued to retrace part of its large recent gains, ended down 20 pesetas at 2,560.
"The session has been prudent on the part of most dealers," said a trader, adding that this was reflected in low volumes and a thin trading range.
Argentaria was subject to selling on disappointing results which prompted talk of a possible share buyback and restructuring, dealers said.
Other banks were mostly higher, but trade was subdued. BBV added 409 pesetas to 6,200 and Santander rose 10 pesetas to 6,650.
